trans-unit.source: Clean Missing Data
trans-unit.target: Clean Missing Data

trans-unit.source: Specifies how to handle the values missing from a dataset
trans-unit.target: Specifies how to handle the values missing from a dataset

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="92B32033-F75F-4854-AC8F-9110B3FE7E09" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Manipulation</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="92B32033-F75F-4854-AC8F-9110B3FE7E09" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Manipulation</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> module to remove missing values, to replace them with a placeholder, mean, or other value, or to completely remove rows and columns with missing values.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> module to remove missing values, to replace them with a placeholder, mean, or other value, or to completely remove rows and columns with missing values.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> does not change your source dataset—it creates a new dataset in your workspace that you can use in the subsequent workflow.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> does not change your source dataset—it creates a new dataset in your workspace that you can use in the subsequent workflow.

trans-unit.source: If you are repeating experiments on the dataset, you might want to save the new, cleaned dataset for reuse.
trans-unit.target: If you are repeating experiments on the dataset, you might want to save the new, cleaned dataset for reuse.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> also outputs a definition of the transformation that you used to clean the missing values.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> also outputs a definition of the transformation that you used to clean the missing values.

trans-unit.source: You can re-use this transformation on other datasets by connecting it to the <link xlink:href="805e592d-0f1f-48eb-97c9-688ed0c1dc70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Transformation</link> module.
trans-unit.target: You can re-use this transformation on other datasets by connecting it to the <link xlink:href="805e592d-0f1f-48eb-97c9-688ed0c1dc70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Transformation</link> module.

trans-unit.source: How to Use Clean Missing Data
trans-unit.target: How to Use Clean Missing Data

trans-unit.source: To replace missing values
trans-unit.target: To replace missing values

trans-unit.source: Connect as the input the dataset that has missing values.
trans-unit.target: Connect as the input the dataset that has missing values.

trans-unit.source: Use the Column Selector to choose the columns that have missing values.
trans-unit.target: Use the Column Selector to choose the columns that have missing values.

trans-unit.source: You can choose multiple columns, but you must use the same replacement method in all selected columns.
trans-unit.target: You can choose multiple columns, but you must use the same replacement method in all selected columns.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to replace some missing values with zeroes in some columns but insert a placeholder in other columns, you should use separate instances of <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to replace some missing values with zeroes in some columns but insert a placeholder in other columns, you should use separate instances of <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select one of the many options for handling missing values.
trans-unit.target: Select one of the many options for handling missing values.

trans-unit.source: These include:
trans-unit.target: These include:

trans-unit.source: Replace missing values with a placeholder.
trans-unit.target: Replace missing values with a placeholder.

trans-unit.source: Replace missing values with a calculated value, such as a mean or imputed value.
trans-unit.target: Replace missing values with a calculated value, such as a mean or imputed value.

trans-unit.source: Delete rows or columns that contain any missing values, or that are completely empty.
trans-unit.target: Delete rows or columns that contain any missing values, or that are completely empty.

trans-unit.source: The complete list of options depends on the data type of the column you are cleaning.
trans-unit.target: The complete list of options depends on the data type of the column you are cleaning.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">options</legacyLink> section for detail.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">options</legacyLink> section for detail.

trans-unit.source: The module returns two outputs:
trans-unit.target: The module returns two outputs:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Cleaned dataset</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Cleaned dataset</ui>.

trans-unit.source: A dataset comprised of the selected columns, with missing values handled as specified.
trans-unit.target: A dataset comprised of the selected columns, with missing values handled as specified.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the dataset containing the replacement values, <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> can output a column that indicates which columns met the specified criteria for cleaning.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the dataset containing the replacement values, <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> can output a column that indicates which columns met the specified criteria for cleaning.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Cleaning transformation</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Cleaning transformation</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The definition of the data transformation used for cleaning can be saved in your workspace and applied to new data later.
trans-unit.target: The definition of the data transformation used for cleaning can be saved in your workspace and applied to new data later.

trans-unit.source: To apply a cleaning transformation to new data
trans-unit.target: To apply a cleaning transformation to new data

trans-unit.source: Add the <link xlink:href="805e592d-0f1f-48eb-97c9-688ed0c1dc70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Transformation</link> module to your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Add the <link xlink:href="805e592d-0f1f-48eb-97c9-688ed0c1dc70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Transformation</link> module to your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Add the dataset you want to clean, and connect the dataset to the right-hand input port.
trans-unit.target: Add the dataset you want to clean, and connect the dataset to the right-hand input port.

trans-unit.source: Expand the <ui>Transforms</ui> group in the left-hand navigation pane.
trans-unit.target: Expand the <ui>Transforms</ui> group in the left-hand navigation pane.

trans-unit.source: Locate the saved transformation and drag it into the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Locate the saved transformation and drag it into the experiment.

trans-unit.source: Connect the saved transformation to the left input port of <link xlink:href="805e592d-0f1f-48eb-97c9-688ed0c1dc70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Transformation</link>.
trans-unit.target: Connect the saved transformation to the left input port of <link xlink:href="805e592d-0f1f-48eb-97c9-688ed0c1dc70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Transformation</link>.

trans-unit.source: Note that when you apply a saved transformation, you do not select the columns to apply it to.
trans-unit.target: Note that when you apply a saved transformation, you do not select the columns to apply it to.

trans-unit.source: That is because the transformation has been already defined and applies automatically to the data types specified in the original operation.
trans-unit.target: That is because the transformation has been already defined and applies automatically to the data types specified in the original operation.

trans-unit.source: One benefit is that, if you created a transformation on a subset of numeric columns, you can later apply this transformation to a dataset of mixed column types without raising an error, and the missing values are changed only in the matching numeric columns.
trans-unit.target: One benefit is that, if you created a transformation on a subset of numeric columns, you can later apply this transformation to a dataset of mixed column types without raising an error, and the missing values are changed only in the matching numeric columns.

trans-unit.source: Run the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Run the experiment.

trans-unit.source: Note these restrictions when applying a saved transformation to new data:
trans-unit.target: Note these restrictions when applying a saved transformation to new data:

trans-unit.source: A saved transformation cannot generate indicator values, even if this option was used in the original cleaning operation.
trans-unit.target: A saved transformation cannot generate indicator values, even if this option was used in the original cleaning operation.

trans-unit.source: Consider the indicator values as most useful when testing a new transformation.
trans-unit.target: Consider the indicator values as most useful when testing a new transformation.

trans-unit.source: The transformation does not calculate new values for the new dataset.
trans-unit.target: The transformation does not calculate new values for the new dataset.

trans-unit.source: In other words, if you used <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> on Dataset A and generated a mean value of 0.5, that same value would be applied as the mean for replacing missing values when applied to Dataset B, regardless of the actual values in Dataset B.
trans-unit.target: In other words, if you used <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> on Dataset A and generated a mean value of 0.5, that same value would be applied as the mean for replacing missing values when applied to Dataset B, regardless of the actual values in Dataset B.

trans-unit.source: The data type of the columns in the new dataset must match the data type of the column that the transformation was originally created on.
trans-unit.target: The data type of the columns in the new dataset must match the data type of the column that the transformation was originally created on.

trans-unit.source: If any other operations are performed on the column that implicitly change the data type, you will get an error.
trans-unit.target: If any other operations are performed on the column that implicitly change the data type, you will get an error.

trans-unit.source: For example, suppose you create a mean for an integer data column [Col1], and save the transformation.
trans-unit.target: For example, suppose you create a mean for an integer data column [Col1], and save the transformation.

trans-unit.source: Now you want to apply the cleanup transformation to a copy of [Col1] that has been adjusted using a formula, such as <math>([Col1] /1.5)</math>.
trans-unit.target: Now you want to apply the cleanup transformation to a copy of [Col1] that has been adjusted using a formula, such as <math>([Col1] /1.5)</math>.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that the result is an integer, you round up the result, but still get an error when you apply the transformation.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that the result is an integer, you round up the result, but still get an error when you apply the transformation.

trans-unit.source: However, no error is raised when you adjust the value using a formula such as <math>([Col 1] * 10)</math>.
trans-unit.target: However, no error is raised when you adjust the value using a formula such as <math>([Col 1] * 10)</math>.

trans-unit.source: You can use <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> to explicitly reset the data type to integer.
trans-unit.target: You can use <link xlink:href="370b6676-c11c-486f-bf73-35349f842a66" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> to explicitly reset the data type to integer.

trans-unit.source: Note that, in general, operations in <link xlink:href="6bd12c13-d9c3-4522-94d3-4aa44513af57" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Math Operation</link> module implicitly change numeric columns to <languageKeyword>double</languageKeyword>.)
trans-unit.target: Note that, in general, operations in <link xlink:href="6bd12c13-d9c3-4522-94d3-4aa44513af57" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Math Operation</link> module implicitly change numeric columns to <languageKeyword>double</languageKeyword>.)

trans-unit.source: Missing Data Options
trans-unit.target: Missing Data Options

trans-unit.source: Use the following parameters to customize the behavior of the <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> module:
trans-unit.target: Use the following parameters to customize the behavior of the <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> module:

trans-unit.source: Columns to be cleaned
trans-unit.target: Columns to be cleaned

trans-unit.source: Select the columns that have missing values to fix by using <ui>Column Selector</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns that have missing values to fix by using <ui>Column Selector</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Note that any method you choose will be applied to <legacyBold>all</legacyBold> columns in the selection; moreover, the module will return an error and stop the experiment if the data in any column is incompatible with the specified operation.
trans-unit.target: Note that any method you choose will be applied to <legacyBold>all</legacyBold> columns in the selection; moreover, the module will return an error and stop the experiment if the data in any column is incompatible with the specified operation.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, typically you will need to select and clean string columns and numeric columns separately, depending on which method you use to replace the missing values.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, typically you will need to select and clean string columns and numeric columns separately, depending on which method you use to replace the missing values.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you specify that missing values be replaced by a mean, the module will return an error message if you selected any string columns.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you specify that missing values be replaced by a mean, the module will return an error message if you selected any string columns.

trans-unit.source: Minimum missing value ratio
trans-unit.target: Minimum missing value ratio

trans-unit.source: Specify the minimum number of missing values required for the operation to be performed.
trans-unit.target: Specify the minimum number of missing values required for the operation to be performed.

trans-unit.source: You define the number as the ratio of missing values to all values in the column.
trans-unit.target: You define the number as the ratio of missing values to all values in the column.

trans-unit.source: By default, the <ui>Minimum missing value ratio</ui> property is set to 0.
trans-unit.target: By default, the <ui>Minimum missing value ratio</ui> property is set to 0.

trans-unit.source: This means that missing values will be cleaned even if there is only one missing value.
trans-unit.target: This means that missing values will be cleaned even if there is only one missing value.

trans-unit.source: This condition must be met by each column in the selection in order for the specified operation to apply.
trans-unit.target: This condition must be met by each column in the selection in order for the specified operation to apply.

trans-unit.source: For example, assume you selected three columns and then set the minimum ratio of missing values to .2 (20%); however, only one column actually has 20% missing values.
trans-unit.target: For example, assume you selected three columns and then set the minimum ratio of missing values to .2 (20%); however, only one column actually has 20% missing values.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the missing values cleanup operation would apply only to the column with over 20% missing values, and the other columns would be unchanged.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the missing values cleanup operation would apply only to the column with over 20% missing values, and the other columns would be unchanged.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Tip:</embeddedLabel> If you have any doubt about whether missing values were changed, select the option, <ui>Generate missing value indicator column</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Tip:</embeddedLabel> If you have any doubt about whether missing values were changed, select the option, <ui>Generate missing value indicator column</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: A column will be appended to the dataset to indicate whether or not each column met the specified criteria for the minimum and maximum ranges.
trans-unit.target: A column will be appended to the dataset to indicate whether or not each column met the specified criteria for the minimum and maximum ranges.

trans-unit.source: Maximum missing value ratio
trans-unit.target: Maximum missing value ratio

trans-unit.source: Specify the maximum number of missing values required for the operation to be performed.
trans-unit.target: Specify the maximum number of missing values required for the operation to be performed.

trans-unit.source: You define the number as the ratio of missing values to all values in the column.
trans-unit.target: You define the number as the ratio of missing values to all values in the column.

trans-unit.source: By default, the <ui>Maximum missing value ratio</ui> is set to 1.
trans-unit.target: By default, the <ui>Maximum missing value ratio</ui> is set to 1.

trans-unit.source: This means that missing values will be cleaned even if 100% of the values in the column are missing.
trans-unit.target: This means that missing values will be cleaned even if 100% of the values in the column are missing.

trans-unit.source: If you specify multiple columns for missing-value cleaning, but some columns do not meet the criteria you set for maximum missing value ratio, those columns will not be changed.
trans-unit.target: If you specify multiple columns for missing-value cleaning, but some columns do not meet the criteria you set for maximum missing value ratio, those columns will not be changed.

trans-unit.source: Cleaning Mode
trans-unit.target: Cleaning Mode

trans-unit.source: Specify how you want missing values handled.
trans-unit.target: Specify how you want missing values handled.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> provides the following methods for replacing missing values:
trans-unit.target: <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui> provides the following methods for replacing missing values:

trans-unit.source: Replace using MICE
trans-unit.target: Replace using MICE

trans-unit.source: For each missing value, this option assigns a new value, which is calculated by using the <legacyItalic>Multivariate Imputation using Chained Equations</legacyItalic> method.
trans-unit.target: For each missing value, this option assigns a new value, which is calculated by using the <legacyItalic>Multivariate Imputation using Chained Equations</legacyItalic> method.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Replace using MICE</ui> option cannot be applied to completely empty columns.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Replace using MICE</ui> option cannot be applied to completely empty columns.

trans-unit.source: Such columns must be removed or passed to the output as is.
trans-unit.target: Such columns must be removed or passed to the output as is.

trans-unit.source: Custom substitution value
trans-unit.target: Custom substitution value

trans-unit.source: Use this option to specify a placeholder value (such as a 0 or NA) that applies to all missing values.
trans-unit.target: Use this option to specify a placeholder value (such as a 0 or NA) that applies to all missing values.

trans-unit.source: The value that you specify as a replacement must be compatible with the data type of the column.
trans-unit.target: The value that you specify as a replacement must be compatible with the data type of the column.

trans-unit.source: Replace with mean
trans-unit.target: Replace with mean

trans-unit.source: Calculates the column mean and uses the mean as the replacement value for each missing value in the column.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the column mean and uses the mean as the replacement value for each missing value in the column.

trans-unit.source: Applies only to columns that have Integer, Double, or Boolean data types.
trans-unit.target: Applies only to columns that have Integer, Double, or Boolean data types.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_TechNotes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for more information.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_TechNotes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for more information.

trans-unit.source: Replace with median
trans-unit.target: Replace with median

trans-unit.source: Calculates the column median value and assigns that as the replacement for any missing value in the column.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the column median value and assigns that as the replacement for any missing value in the column.

trans-unit.source: Applies only to columns that have Integer or Double data types.
trans-unit.target: Applies only to columns that have Integer or Double data types.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_TechNotes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for more information.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_TechNotes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for more information.

trans-unit.source: Replace with mode
trans-unit.target: Replace with mode

trans-unit.source: Calculates the mode for the column and uses that as the replacement value for every missing value in the column.
trans-unit.target: Calculates the mode for the column and uses that as the replacement value for every missing value in the column.

trans-unit.source: Applies to columns that have Integer, Double, Boolean, or Categorical data types.
trans-unit.target: Applies to columns that have Integer, Double, Boolean, or Categorical data types.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_TechNotes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for more information.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_TechNotes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for more information.

trans-unit.source: Remove entire row
trans-unit.target: Remove entire row

trans-unit.source: Completely removes any row in the dataset that has one or more missing values.
trans-unit.target: Completely removes any row in the dataset that has one or more missing values.

trans-unit.source: This is useful if the missing value can be considered randomly missing.
trans-unit.target: This is useful if the missing value can be considered randomly missing.

trans-unit.source: Remove entire column
trans-unit.target: Remove entire column

trans-unit.source: Completely removes any column in the dataset that has one or more missing values.
trans-unit.target: Completely removes any column in the dataset that has one or more missing values.

trans-unit.source: Replace using Probabilistic PCA
trans-unit.target: Replace using Probabilistic PCA

trans-unit.source: Replaces the missing values by using a linear model that analyzes the correlations between the columns and estimates a low-dimensional approximation of the data, from which the full data is reconstructed.
trans-unit.target: Replaces the missing values by using a linear model that analyzes the correlations between the columns and estimates a low-dimensional approximation of the data, from which the full data is reconstructed.

trans-unit.source: The underlying dimensionality reduction is a probabilistic form of Principal Component Analysis (PCA), and it implements a variant of the model proposed in the Journal of the Royal Statistical Society, Series B 21(3), 611–622 by Tipping and Bishop.
trans-unit.target: The underlying dimensionality reduction is a probabilistic form of Principal Component Analysis (PCA), and it implements a variant of the model proposed in the Journal of the Royal Statistical Society, Series B 21(3), 611–622 by Tipping and Bishop.

trans-unit.source: Compared to other options, such as Multiple Imputation using Chained Equations (MICE), this option has the advantage of not requiring the application of predictors for each column.
trans-unit.target: Compared to other options, such as Multiple Imputation using Chained Equations (MICE), this option has the advantage of not requiring the application of predictors for each column.

trans-unit.source: Instead, it approximates the covariance for the full dataset.
trans-unit.target: Instead, it approximates the covariance for the full dataset.

trans-unit.source: It may therefore offer better performance for datasets that have missing values in many columns.
trans-unit.target: It may therefore offer better performance for datasets that have missing values in many columns.

trans-unit.source: The key limitations of this method are that it expands categorical columns into numerical indicators and computes a dense covariance matrix of the resulting data.
trans-unit.target: The key limitations of this method are that it expands categorical columns into numerical indicators and computes a dense covariance matrix of the resulting data.

trans-unit.source: It also is not optimized for sparse representations.
trans-unit.target: It also is not optimized for sparse representations.

trans-unit.source: For these reasons, datasets with large numbers of columns and/or large categorical domains (tens of thousands) are not supported due to prohibitive space consumption.
trans-unit.target: For these reasons, datasets with large numbers of columns and/or large categorical domains (tens of thousands) are not supported due to prohibitive space consumption.

trans-unit.source: Replacement value
trans-unit.target: Replacement value

trans-unit.source: After you have selected one of the methods that support a user-specified replacement value, you can type the new value, and it will be used as the replacement value for all missing values in the column.
trans-unit.target: After you have selected one of the methods that support a user-specified replacement value, you can type the new value, and it will be used as the replacement value for all missing values in the column.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can use this option only in columns with the Integer, Double, Boolean, or Date data types.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can use this option only in columns with the Integer, Double, Boolean, or Date data types.

trans-unit.source: For date columns, the replacement value can also be entered as the number of 100-nanosecond ticks since 1/1/0001 12:00 A.M.
trans-unit.target: For date columns, the replacement value can also be entered as the number of 100-nanosecond ticks since 1/1/0001 12:00 A.M.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: Sample Results
trans-unit.target: Sample Results

trans-unit.source: For example, the following table shows some columns from the automobile prices sample dataset, which is relatively small but has many columns with missing values.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following table shows some columns from the automobile prices sample dataset, which is relatively small but has many columns with missing values.

trans-unit.source: The table shows the number of missing values and the ratio of missing values overall.
trans-unit.target: The table shows the number of missing values and the ratio of missing values overall.

trans-unit.source: If the minimum ratio of missing values is set to 0.019 and the maximum ratio of missing values is set to 0.020, the missing values in the <database>Normalized-losses</database> column will not be cleaned and will be left as is.
trans-unit.target: If the minimum ratio of missing values is set to 0.019 and the maximum ratio of missing values is set to 0.020, the missing values in the <database>Normalized-losses</database> column will not be cleaned and will be left as is.

trans-unit.source: Column name
trans-unit.target: Column name

trans-unit.source: Count of missing values
trans-unit.target: Count of missing values

trans-unit.source: Ratio of missing values
trans-unit.target: Ratio of missing values

trans-unit.source: Normalized-losses
trans-unit.target: Normalized-losses

trans-unit.source: Bore
trans-unit.target: Bore

trans-unit.source: Stroke
trans-unit.target: Stroke

trans-unit.source: If you are uncertain about whether missing value cleanup worked, select the <ui>Generate missing value indicator column</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: If you are uncertain about whether missing value cleanup worked, select the <ui>Generate missing value indicator column</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: A column will be appended to the dataset for each column that met the criteria for the minimum and maximum ranges.
trans-unit.target: A column will be appended to the dataset for each column that met the criteria for the minimum and maximum ranges.

trans-unit.source: Columns that have missing values but that did not meet the criteria will not have an indicator column.
trans-unit.target: Columns that have missing values but that did not meet the criteria will not have an indicator column.

trans-unit.source: Gallery Examples
trans-unit.target: Gallery Examples

trans-unit.source: You can see examples of how this module is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: You can see examples of how this module is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Prediction of student performance</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525727</linkUri></externalLink> sample, zeros are inserted for missing values.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Prediction of student performance</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525727</linkUri></externalLink> sample, zeros are inserted for missing values.

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Cross Validation for Binary Classifier sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525734</linkUri></externalLink>, zeros are used to fill-in for missing values, but an indicator column is created to track the changes.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Cross Validation for Binary Classifier sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525734</linkUri></externalLink>, zeros are used to fill-in for missing values, but an indicator column is created to track the changes.

trans-unit.source: Columns with all missing values are also retained.
trans-unit.target: Columns with all missing values are also retained.

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Dataset Processing and Analysis</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525733</linkUri></externalLink> sample, different branches of the experiment use different methods for missing value substitution, and the datasets are then evaluated by using <link xlink:href="2c57074f-674f-45de-ad85-d84e4726f04e" DisplayType="title" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Descriptive Statistics</link> and <link xlink:href="72a2eeb2-73fe-4384-8a8b-5478aba2ffb3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Linear Correlation</link>.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Dataset Processing and Analysis</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525733</linkUri></externalLink> sample, different branches of the experiment use different methods for missing value substitution, and the datasets are then evaluated by using <link xlink:href="2c57074f-674f-45de-ad85-d84e4726f04e" DisplayType="title" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Descriptive Statistics</link> and <link xlink:href="72a2eeb2-73fe-4384-8a8b-5478aba2ffb3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Linear Correlation</link>.

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Flight delay prediction sample</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/837e2095ce784f1ba5ac623a60232027</linkUri></externalLink>, empty rows are removed.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Flight delay prediction sample</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/837e2095ce784f1ba5ac623a60232027</linkUri></externalLink>, empty rows are removed.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: An error occurs if the mean or median option is used when any string columns are selected.
trans-unit.target: An error occurs if the mean or median option is used when any string columns are selected.

trans-unit.source: If you need to process columns of different data types, create two instances of <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If you need to process columns of different data types, create two instances of <ui>Clean Missing Data</ui>.

trans-unit.source: When replacing missing values with a mean value in columns with the Boolean, Integer, DateTime, or TimeSpan data types, the column is first converted to floating point numbers, the mean is calculated, and then the result is rounded to the nearest value of the original data type.
trans-unit.target: When replacing missing values with a mean value in columns with the Boolean, Integer, DateTime, or TimeSpan data types, the column is first converted to floating point numbers, the mean is calculated, and then the result is rounded to the nearest value of the original data type.

trans-unit.source: When you type a replacement value, the value must be compatible with the data type in the selected column.
trans-unit.target: When you type a replacement value, the value must be compatible with the data type in the selected column.

trans-unit.source: Values of NaN, Inf, and –Inf are allowed for columns where the data type is Double.
trans-unit.target: Values of NaN, Inf, and –Inf are allowed for columns where the data type is Double.

trans-unit.source: When using the MICE method, the replacement value is predicted by using the trained MICE model.
trans-unit.target: When using the MICE method, the replacement value is predicted by using the trained MICE model.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if one or more parameters could not be parsed or converted from the specified type into the type required by the target method.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if one or more parameters could not be parsed or converted from the specified type into the type required by the target method.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if one or more input datasets are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if one or more input datasets are null or empty.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if a parameter is not in range.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if a parameter is not in range.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if the leaner passed to the module has an invalid type.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if the leaner passed to the module has an invalid type.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if the input dataset is not valid.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if the input dataset is not valid.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if the operation fails.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if the operation fails.
